components.description:
A friendly, cartoon-styled face of a hamster—a small rodent often kept as a pet—looking straight ahead. Generally depicted as a brown-and-white faced hamster with whiskers, a pink nose, puffy cheeks, and large, round, pink ears, sometimes with a buck tooth.

Often used with an affectionate tone. May be used to represent a gerbil, guinea pig, chinchilla, or related animals. Does not have a full-bodied hamster emoji counterpart.

Not to be confused with üê≠ Mouse Face.

Microsoft’s hamster was previously gray.
components.title: Hamster Face

description:
A friendly, cartoon-styled face of a hamster—a small rodent often kept as a pet—looking straight ahead. Generally depicted as a brown-and-white faced hamster with whiskers, a pink nose, puffy cheeks, and large, round, pink ears, sometimes with a buck tooth.

Often used with an affectionate tone. May be used to represent a gerbil, guinea pig, chinchilla, or related animals. Does not have a full-bodied hamster emoji counterpart.

Not to be confused with üê≠ Mouse Face.

title: Hamster Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal faces
emoji_net_data.definition: A cute hamster, with pink ears, orange over half its face, and white/gray for the other part of the face. Has three whiskers on each side. H http://emojipedia.org/hamster-face/
emoji_net_data.name: hamster face

bn:00061787n: Animal kept for companionship and a person's enjoyment

A pet is an animal kept primarily for a person's company or protection, as opposed to working animals, sport animals, livestock, and laboratory animals, which are kept primarily for performance, agricultural value, or research.
An animal which is kept in the home as a companion and treated affectionately.
An animal kept as a companion.
A domesticated animal kept for companionship or amusement

bn:00042754n: Hamsters are rodents belonging to the subfamily Cricetinae.
A rodent belonging to the subfamily Cricetinae.
A subfamily of the family Cricetidae, comprising rodents having a pouch on each side of their heads where they store food to be eaten later.
Any of various Old-World rodent species belonging to the subfamily .
Short-tailed Old World burrowing rodent with large cheek pouches

bn:00056119n: A mouse is a small mammal belonging to the order of rodents, characteristically having a pointed snout, small rounded ears, and a long naked or almost hairless tail.
A genus of rodents containing many kinds of mice
A medium-sized rodent belonging to the genus Rattus.
Any small rodent of the genus Mus.
Any of numerous small rodents typically resembling diminutive rats having pointed snouts and small ears on elongated bodies with slender usually hairless tails
A mouse is a small mammal belonging to the order of rodents, characteristically having a pointed snout, small rounded ears, a body-length scaly tail and a high breeding rate.
Any of numerous small rodents of the genera ''rattus'', ''mus'', or various other related genera of the ''Murid√¶'' family characterised by a long hairless tail, rounded ears, and a pointed nose.

bn:00016891n: The guinea pig, also called the cavy, is a species of rodent belonging to the family Caviidae and the genus Cavia.
Stout-bodied nearly tailless domesticated cavy; often kept as a pet and widely used in research
A tailless rodent of the the family Caviidae and the genus Cavia genus, with short ears and larger than a hamster; the species Cavia porcellus is often kept as a pet.
A domestic species of rodent that is popular as a pet
